issue.title: Force building everything on integration tests to work around gib issue

labels.name: area/infra-automation
labels.description: anything related to CI, bots, etc. that are used to automated our infrastructure

body: The problem only seems to happen when gib would like to build a subset of the modules. If gib generates an empty `GIB_IMPACTED` set, the integration tests run normally.

issue.title: GIB experiment: Deliberate failure in pl job
issue.body: Experiment to validate whether GIB is operating correctly when `-pl` is used. See https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/46367.

body: I did an experiment to see if `-Dgib.disableSelectedProjectsHandling` helped, and ... it did not. Which isn't too surprising, based on the docs, but the docs also say `-f` should work fine, so ...

I did another experiment, to see if `cd` into the directory we want to change both change the relative path root, and I suspect a mismatch in where relative paths come from in the gib set and what the pom sees is maybe the problem.

That is, gib may be wanting to match `integration-tests/openapi`, but the pom would think of that submodule as `openapi`. I saw something similar when I had to strip `integration-tests/` from the `-pl` arguments I passed to mvn when i also had a `-f` flag.
FTR, I received then ping but I won't be able to look into this issue before late sunday evening.

@famod FWIW, I worked on something to inject the list of modules directly in the matrix instead of rerunning GIB again in the JVM case. I think it's probably a good idea going forward. It's on top of my work on RunsOn though but I can create a draft PR.

issue.body:
Fixes https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/46367

Do not merge for now but it needs experimentation in CI.

Note: it includes the work in https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/46356 so just have a look at the last commit.

body: @famod I created https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/46421 (will see how CI reacts)

I can reproduce this behavior locally by changing the BOM an running:
> ./mvnw validate -Pincremental  -Dgib.rb=upstream/main -f integration-tests

Adding `-X` reveals:
> [DEBUG] Ignoring changed file in non-reactor module: /home/famod/proj/quarkus/bom/application/pom.xml

The docs could certainly do a better job in hinting at that pitfall, but it's just the way it has always worked (or hasn't).
Note that this message was demoted from WARNING to DEBUG back in 2022/4.2.0: https://github.com/gitflow-incremental-builder/gitflow-incremental-builder/issues/567

So, GIB needs the full reactor but Maven is trimming it down when using `-f`.

Btw, this is not specific to BOM changes; same happens when touching e.g. `build-parent/pom.xml`.

I'll have a look at #46421 tomorrow or so.

issue.title: Change detection not working as expected for child projects of modules selected with `-f` or `cd` (so they are not built)

repository.name: gitflow-incremental-builder
repository.description: A Maven extension for incremental building of multi-module projects when using Git Flow (or Git in general).

issue.body:
#### The scenario 

A project with some nesting of modules, such as 

```
- A
  - BB
     - CC
     - DD 
  - EE
```

GIB is invoked as follows:

```
./mvnw clean install -f BB -Dincremental -Dgib.disableSelectedProjectsHandling -Dgib.untracked=false -Dgib.uncommitted=false  -Dgib.referenceBranch=refs/remotes/quarkusio/main -Dgib.fetchReferenceBranch -Dgib.disableIfBranchMatches='main|\d+\.\d+|.*backport.*'
```

or 

```
cd BB
./mvnw clean install -Dincremental -Dgib.disableSelectedProjectsHandling -Dgib.untracked=false -Dgib.uncommitted=false  -Dgib.referenceBranch=refs/remotes/quarkusio/main -Dgib.fetchReferenceBranch -Dgib.disableIfBranchMatches='main|\d+\.\d+|.*backport.*'
```

If the gib log ends up empty, indicating all projects need to be built, everything works fine. However, if specific projects such as `CC` or `DD` are listed, they don't get built. The parent `BB` gets built, but no children.

The [docs](https://github.com/gitflow-incremental-builder/gitflow-incremental-builder?tab=readme-ov-file#mvn--f-and-others) say normal selection rules are supposed to apply to a module with submodules that is selected via `-f` or via `cd`.

@famod has done [some debugging](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/46367#issuecomment-2677185602), and has this analysis:

> I can reproduce this behavior locally by changing [a file outside the subfolder] and running:
>    ./mvnw validate -Pincremental -Dgib.rb=upstream/main -f integration-tests
>
> Adding -X reveals:
> 
>   [DEBUG] Ignoring changed file in non-reactor module: /home/famod/proj/quarkus/bom/application/pom.xml
> The docs could certainly do a better job in hinting at that pitfall, but it's just the way it has always worked (or hasn't).
> Note that this message was demoted from WARNING to DEBUG back in 2022/4.2.0: https://github.com/gitflow-incremental-builder/gitflow-incremental-builder/issues/567
> 
> So, GIB needs the full reactor but Maven is trimming it down when using -f.
